instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - working but slightly high fan spin after <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> replacement.
threads.message:
ASD EFi showing battery sensor temp error.

logic board is working great, can charge and see the battery, but fan spin is abnormal. ive already tested with couple of known original working battery and still same.
coconutbattery app show all the info fine, even battery temp is fine too.

should i leave it or has to be repair?

[IMG type="full" width="200px"]http://i64.tinypic.com/2d6uom0.jpg[/IMG]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - working but slightly high fan spin after <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> replacement.
threads.message: Battery will not cause high fan spin, it should run normal without battery connected. Run ASD again without the battery and see which sensor fails.
